title: Citi Introduces Acclaimed App for iPad to Global Marketplace
summary: New York - Citi announced a global rollout of its acclaimed Citibank® for iPad app. Designed and launched in the U.S. in 2011, Citibank for iPad was released recently in Russia and Hong Kong. Throughout 2013, Citi plans to launch the app in other key markets in Asia-Pacific, Latin America and Europe. Once live in a particular market, the app enables Citi customers with bank or credit card accounts there to access their account information and perform transactions on their iPad devices. The global rollout of Citibank for iPad is the latest example of Citi's efforts to use its global footprint to bring the latest in digital banking to customers in cities throughout the world.
tag-1: Citi Introduces Acclaimed App for iPad to Global Marketplace
tag-3: New York – Citi announced a global rollout of its acclaimed Citibank® for iPad app. Designed and launched in the U.S. in 2011, Citibank for iPad was released recently in Russia and Hong Kong. Throughout 2013, Citi plans to launch the app in other key markets in Asia-Pacific, Latin America and Europe. Once live in a particular market, the app enables Citi customers with bank or credit card accounts there to access their account information and perform transactions on their iPad devices. The global rollout of Citibank for iPad is the latest example of Citi's efforts to use its global footprint to bring the latest in digital banking to customers in cities throughout the world.
tag-4: "The rollout of Citibank for iPad marks the most recent example where Citi has helped to simplify the lives of its customers by bringing them top-tier digital banking wherever they are in the world," said Marc Luet, Citi Chief Executive Officer of Consumer Banking in Europe the Middle East and Africa. "Citibank for iPad has been heralded in the US as the leading bank tablet app because of its state-of-the-art design and features. We are pleased to bring its advanced capabilities to the ever growing number of mobile users."
tag-5: With the launch of Citibank for iPad, Citi became the first major U.S. bank to depart from traditional ledger-style banking and offer graphs and visual representations of consumer banking accounts and transactions. The app has been continuously recognized as the industry leader by research consultancies and industry observers:
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
